title: Grow Inspired -- Mary's Fiber Ranch
description:
A celebration of individuals whose generosity, hard work and connection with nature inspire us every day.

Rebecca Burgess is a revitalizer of natural dyeing techniques, ecological restoration educator, textile artist, author of the book "Harvesting Color" and founder of Ecologicalarts and the Fibershed Project in Mill Valley, California. Mary Pettis-Sarley is trained in textile and visual design. She has been ranching for over 30 years and combines her love of fiber and ranching. Her ranch includes several breeds of sheep, angora goats, llamas and alpacas that she blends to form yarns that are made at Yolo Wool Mill.

We've always been inspired by the Midwest Backyard Garden. It's a place that brings us joy-where we connect with family and friends. Grow inspired is a seasonal celebration that recognizes our neighbors who share their passion for gardening, nature and the great outdoors with their community.

transcripts: we sheared 118 sheep yesterday and I've got about 20 Angora goats, there five llamas, 40 alpacas, 17 dogs, there are 150 mother cows and most of them have babies, and 17 or 18 horses, so these are some of the yarns that come from this ranch the person who works with both the animals and creates the natural dye experience here is Mary so this represents alpaca animals and gora goats bude fried or breeds of sheep and then a multitude of plants and llama and llama. It's the Diane the animal it's a combination of the two like that's eucalyptus from one of the cow pastures and it's on a blend of Blanche who's my little, my little llama. This is the Japanese indigo that you grew, yeah it's not blue because the leaves were dried and then boiled but this is more indicative of what you think indigo is and this is indigo on Blanche, on blanche again the wild aster is a plant from the ranch and it produces a really beautiful yellow eucalyptus die on noodle and noodle is the, this noodle too, noodle is a sheep I know and noodle is so sweet and the plant we just harvested was euphorbia and on the animal it says winter garden blend on june and so June was at the California variegated mutant lamb that's the breed name mixed with alpaca and mohare.
